info.name: SiGREEN
info.description: SiGREEN offers a suite of powerful APIs designed to revolutionize your PCF management practices. With SiGREEN X-Link, you can easily connect your Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems to SiGREEN.

item.name: GET the outbound pcf requests of my company. it is recommended to make use of the "status" query parameter as follows /tasks/outboundPcfRequests?status=NEW,PCF_RECEIVED,COMPLETED.

query.description: Free text search for outbound pcf requests that will look in the attribute of Task ID,component name,supplierName of a company in SiGREEN.
Component name of the company in SiGREEN
Task Id for identifying the outbound pcf request of the company in SiGREEN
UUID of the Task for identifying the outbound pcf request of the company in SiGREEN
SupplierId of the supplier company
Name of the supplier company
Id for identifying the pcf data received in my company
MaterialCategory of the component my company

Outbound pcf request status. Multiple fields could be used separated by commas (e.g. "PCF_RECEIVED","UNDER_REVIEW"). Available values : NEW, PCF_RECEIVED, UNDER_REVIEW, WITHDRAWN, COMPLETED, REJECTED_PCF, DENIED, CANCELLED
The start date of the date range when the task was created or updated in SiGREEN.DateTime (ISO 8601; UTC Timezone)
The end date of the date range when the task was created or update in SiGREEN.DateTime (ISO 8601; UTC Timezone)

The order of returned elements.sort supporting fields(taskId,componentName,supplierName,supplierId,requestTimeStamp) in outbound pcf requests.Descending order could be requested by appending '-' ,ascending '+' at the prefix of parameter.(e.g. '+taskId)'
This is an integer representing the page-number to fetch. 0 would be the first page.(e.g 'page=0')
This is used for the requested maximum page size.(e.g. 'size=10')
